Class AlphaBeta

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
engine.forPlayer.forAI.AlphaBeta
All Implemented Interfaces:
MoveStrategy
public class AlphaBeta extends Observable implements MoveStrategy
The AlphaBeta class implements a chess engine using the alpha-beta search algorithm with Lazy SMP parallel search optimization. This implementation employs advanced chess engine techniques including iterative deepening, aspiration windows, transposition tables, quiescence search, null move pruning, late move reductions, and various move ordering heuristics to achieve high-performance chess move selection.

The engine uses multiple threads with the Young Brothers Wait concept to improve search efficiency while maintaining search quality. It incorporates modern pruning techniques and evaluation caching to reduce the search space and improve performance.

Author:
Aaron Ho

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    private static enum 
    AlphaBeta.MoveSorter
    The MoveSorter enumeration defines different strategies for ordering moves to improve alpha-beta search efficiency.
    private static class 
    AlphaBeta.SearchStats
    The SearchStats class tracks performance statistics for individual search threads during parallel search operations.
    private static class 
    AlphaBeta.StripedTranspositionTable
    The StripedTranspositionTable class implements a thread-safe transposition table using striped locking to reduce contention in parallel search operations.

  • Constructor Details

    • AlphaBeta

      public AlphaBeta(int maxDepth, Board board)
      Constructs a AlphaBeta chess engine with the specified maximum search depth. Initializes the thread pool, transposition table, and determines the appropriate board evaluator based on the current game state.
      Parameters:
      maxDepth - The maximum depth for iterative deepening search.
      board - The initial board position for evaluator selection.

      Returns a string representation of this chess engine.
      Overrides:

    • execute

      public Move execute(Board board)
      Executes the alpha-beta search algorithm with iterative deepening and parallel search to find the best move for the current player. Uses aspiration windows, transposition tables, and various pruning techniques to optimize search performance.
      Specified by:
      execute in interface MoveStrategy
      Parameters:
      board - The current chess board position.
      Returns:
      The best move determined by the search algorithm.

    • getCachedEvaluation

      private double getCachedEvaluation(Board board, int depth)
      Retrieves a cached board evaluation or computes a new evaluation if not found in cache.
      Parameters:
      board - The board position to evaluate.
      depth - The search depth for the evaluation.
      Returns:
      The evaluation score for the board position.

    • searchRootAspirationWindow

      private Move searchRootAspirationWindow(Board board, int depth, Move previousBestMove)
      Implements aspiration window search for deeper iterations to reduce search time by using narrow alpha-beta windows based on previous search results.
      Parameters:
      board - The root board position.
      depth - The current search depth.
      previousBestMove - The best move from the previous iteration.
      Returns:
      The best move found with aspiration window search.

    • searchRootParallel

      private Move searchRootParallel(Board board, int depth, double alpha, double beta)
      Searches the root position using parallel Lazy SMP search with Young Brothers Wait protocol. Distributes move searching across multiple threads for improved performance.
      Parameters:
      board - The root board position.
      depth - The current search depth.
      alpha - The alpha bound for alpha-beta search.
      beta - The beta bound for alpha-beta search.
      Returns:
      The best move found by the parallel search.

    • searchFirstMove

      private void searchFirstMove(Board board, Move move, int depth, AtomicReference<Move> bestMove, AtomicReference<Double> bestScore, double alpha, double beta)
      Searches the first move at the root using the Young Brothers Wait protocol to ensure the most promising move is fully explored before other threads begin.
      Parameters:
      board - The root board position.
      move - The first move to search.
      depth - The search depth.
      bestMove - Reference to the current best move.
      bestScore - Reference to the current best score.
      alpha - The alpha bound.
      beta - The beta bound.

    • searchMove

      private void searchMove(Board board, Move move, Board toBoard, int depth, AtomicReference<Move> bestMove, AtomicReference<Double> bestScore, double alpha, double beta)
      Searches a specific move and updates the best move and score if a better result is found.
      Parameters:
      board - The current board position.
      move - The move to search.
      toBoard - The board position after the move.
      depth - The search depth.
      bestMove - Reference to the current best move.
      bestScore - Reference to the current best score.
      alpha - The alpha bound.
      beta - The beta bound.

    • recordCounterMove

      private void recordCounterMove(Board board, Move move)
      Records a move as a countermove response to the last opponent move for move ordering.
      Parameters:
      board - The current board position.
      move - The move to record as a countermove.

      toBoard - The board position to evaluate.
      depth - The current search depth.
      Returns:

    • max

      private double max(Board board, int depth, double alpha, double beta, int ply)
      Implements the maximizing player portion of the alpha-beta search algorithm with various pruning techniques and search extensions.
      Parameters:
      board - The current board position.
      depth - The remaining search depth.
      alpha - The alpha bound.
      beta - The beta bound.
      ply - The current search ply.
      Returns:
      The best evaluation score for the maximizing player.

    • min

      private double min(Board board, int depth, double alpha, double beta, int ply)
      Implements the minimizing player portion of the alpha-beta search algorithm with various pruning techniques and search extensions.
      Parameters:
      board - The current board position.
      depth - The remaining search depth.
      alpha - The alpha bound.
      beta - The beta bound.
      ply - The current search ply.
      Returns:
      The best evaluation score for the minimizing player.

    • quiescenceSearch

      private double quiescenceSearch(Board board, double alpha, double beta, int ply, boolean maximizing)
      Implements quiescence search to handle tactical sequences involving captures and checks to avoid the horizon effect in evaluation.
      Parameters:
      board - The current board position.
      alpha - The alpha bound.
      beta - The beta bound.
      ply - The current search ply.
      maximizing - True if this is a maximizing node, false for minimizing.
      Returns:
      The quiescence search evaluation score.

    • findMoveFromHash

      private Move findMoveFromHash(Board board, TranspositionTable.Entry entry)
      Attempts to find a specific move from a transposition table entry. This is a simplified implementation that searches for matching board positions.
      Parameters:
      board - The current board position.
      entry - The transposition table entry.
      Returns:
      The move corresponding to the entry, or null if not found.

    • makeNullMove

      private Board makeNullMove(Board board)
      Creates a board position where the current player passes their turn (null move). Used for null move pruning in the search algorithm.
      Parameters:
      board - The current board position.
      Returns:
      A new board with the same position but opposite side to move.

    • hasNonPawnMaterial

      private boolean hasNonPawnMaterial(Player player)
      Checks whether a player has non-pawn material remaining on the board. Used to determine if null move pruning is safe to apply.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to check for non-pawn material.
      Returns:
      True if the player has pieces other than pawns and king, false otherwise.

    • updateHistoryHeuristic

      private void updateHistoryHeuristic(Move move, int depth)
      Updates the history heuristic table with information about a good move to improve move ordering in future searches.
      Parameters:
      move - The move to record in the history heuristic.
      depth - The depth at which this move was found to be good.

    • determineGameState

      private BoardEvaluator determineGameState(Board board)
      Determines the appropriate board evaluator based on the current game state. Uses game phase detection to select between opening, middlegame, and endgame evaluators.
      Parameters:
      board - The current board position.
      Returns:
      The appropriate board evaluator for the game state.
